page.title: 08BIRDS IN THE SAMPFORDS
page.content: The most common birds in The Sampfords are the Sparrows and the Woodpigeons.A Kingfisher has been seen every year by the River Pant but it has not been seen this year yet.The most beautiful birds in The Sampfords are the Kingfisher,the Mallard Drake and the Cock Pheasant.The biggest bird is the Grey Heron.In Gt. Howe Wood there are lots of little owls and some Tawny owls.Barn owls are quite rare but there are some in the district.Also in Gt. Howe Wood there is a Nightingale.This was heard by some village people.On our school bird table we have had two rare visitors.These are the Reed Bunting and the Coal Tit.They came for the food that we put out daily.
